required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Primary Vaccination Study With a Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Healthy Children 6-12wks of Age
clinical_study.official_title: Non-inferiority of a Commercial Lot of the Pneumococcal Vaccine GSK1024850A Compared to a Clinical Lot.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present study is to demonstrate that the changes in the manufacturing process for the commercial lot of the pneumococcal conjugate vaccine GSK1024850A have no clinical impact and that the immune responses are non-inferior to the immune responses induced by the clinical lot. The study will be conducted in Singapore and Malaysia.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Antibodies Against Vaccine Components of the Pneumococcal Vaccine
primary_outcome.description: Concentrations are given as Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) in microgram per milliliter (μg/mL). Vaccine pneumococcal serotypes assessed included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F and 23F.

primary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Antibody Against Protein D (PD)
primary_outcome.description: Concentration was expressed as GMC in GSK's 22F enzyme-linked-immunosorbent assay (ELISA) units per milliliter (EL.U/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-pneumococcal Vaccine Serotype Antibody Concentrations Equal to or Above 0.20 µg/mL
Number of Subjects With Anti-pneumococcal Cross-reactive Serotype Concentrations Equal to or Above 0.20 µg/mL
Number of Subjects With Opsonophagocytic Activity Against Vaccine Pneumococcal Serotypes
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine pneumococcal serotypes included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F. Opsonophagocytic activity was defined as the dilution of serum (opsonic titer) able to sustain 50% killing of live pneumococci under the assay conditions. The cut-off of the assay was an opsonic titer equal to or greater than 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Opsonophagocytic Activity Against Cross-reactive Pneumococcal Serotypes
secondary_outcome.description: Cross-reactive pneumococcal serotypes were 6A and 19A. Opsonophagocytic activity was defined as the dilution of serum (opsonic titer) able to sustain 50% killing of live pneumococci under the assay conditions. The cut-off of the assay was an opsonic titer equal to or greater than 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Opsonophagocytic Titers of Cross-reactive Pneumococcal Serotypes
secondary_outcome.description: Opsonophagocytic titers were expressed as GMTs. Cross-reactive pneumococcal serotypes included 6A and 19A.
Titers were given as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Antibodies Against Diphteria Toxoid (DT) and Tetanus Toxoid (TT)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations were defined as GMCs in international units per milliter (IU/mL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Antibody Against Hepatitis B Surface Antigen (HBs)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration was given as GMC in milli international units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Antibody Against Rotavirus Immunoglobulin A (IgA)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentration was expressed as GMC in units per milliliter (U/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following vaccination and throughout the entire study period (Month 0 to Month 4)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, is life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.

secondary_outcome.measure: Opsonophagocytic Titers of Vaccine Pneumococcal Serotypes
secondary_outcome.description: Titers are presented as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs). Pneumococcal serotypes included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F and 23F.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local and General Symptoms.
secondary_outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, fever, irritability, loss of appetite, diarrhoea and vomiting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentrations of Antibodies Against Pertussis Toxoid (PT), Filamentous Haemagglutinin (FHA), Pertactin (PRN)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations are expressed as GMCs in EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Antibody Against Polyribosyl-ribitol Phosphate (PRP)
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrain was expressed as GMC in µg/mL.
An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.

arm_group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

Subjects received 3 doses of the commercial lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the lright thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 or 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

intervention.description: Intramuscular injection, 3 doses in Malaysia and 2 doses in Singapore
Intramuscular injection, only for Visit 2 in Singapore

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects between, and including 6-12 weeks of age at the time of the first vaccination.
- Subjects for whom the investigator believes that their parent(s)/guardian(s) can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- Written or oral, signed or thumb-printed informed consent obtained from the parent(s)/guardian(s) of the child/ward.
- Free of any known or suspected health problems (as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study).
- Born after a gestation period of >= 36 to <= 42 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) other than the study vaccines within 30 days preceding the first dose of the study vaccines, or planned use during the study period.
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period.
- Chronic administration (defined as more than 14 days) of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs since birth.
- A family history of congenital or hereditary immunodeficiency.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition based on medical history and physical examination.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products since birth or planned administration during the study period (with the exception of hepatitis B immunoglobulins at birth).
- Previous vaccination against diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, poliomyelitis, hepatitis B, Haemophilus influenzae type b and/or Streptococcus pneumoniae (with the exception of vaccines where the first dose can be given within the first two weeks of life).
- Planned administration/administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol during the period starting 30 days before each dose of vaccine and ending 7 days after Dose 1 and Dose 2 and 30 days after Dose 3.
- History of, or intercurrent diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B, poliomyelitis, H. influenzae type b and rotavirus disease.
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccines.
- History of any neurological disorders or seizures.
- Major congenital defects or serious chronic illness.
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment.
- Gastroenteritis within 7 days preceding the study vaccine administration.
- Any clinically significant history of chronic gastrointestinal disease including any uncorrected congenital malformation of the gastrointestinal tract, intussusception or other medical condition determined to be serious by the investigator.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: Concentrations are given as Geometric Mean Concentrations (GMCs) in microgram per milliliter (μg/mL). Vaccine pneumococcal serotypes assessed included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F and 23F.

outcome.description: Vaccine pneumococcal serotypes included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F, and 23F. Opsonophagocytic activity was defined as the dilution of serum (opsonic titer) able to sustain 50% killing of live pneumococci under the assay conditions. The cut-off of the assay was an opsonic titer equal to or greater than 8.

outcome.title: Concentration of Antibody Against Rotavirus Immunoglobulin A (IgA)
outcome.description: Concentration was expressed as GMC in units per milliliter (U/mL).
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom immunogenicity data were available.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

group.title: Synflorix Commercial Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the commercial lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the lright thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 or 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

measure.title: Concentration of Antibody Against Rotavirus Immunoglobulin A (IgA)
measure.description: Concentration was expressed as GMC in units per milliliter (U/mL).
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom immunogenicity data were available.

outcome.title: Occurrence of Serious Adverse Events
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, is life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.
outcome.time_frame: Following vaccination and throughout the entire study period (Month 0 to Month 4)
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

group.title: Synflorix Commercial Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the commercial lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the lright thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 or 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

measure.title: Occurrence of Serious Adverse Events
measure.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, is life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization, result in disability/incapacity or are a congenital anomaly/birth defect in the offspring of a study subject.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects.

outcome.title: Opsonophagocytic Titers of Vaccine Pneumococcal Serotypes
outcome.description: Titers are presented as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs). Pneumococcal serotypes included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F and 23F.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom immunogenicity data were available.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

group.title: Synflorix Commercial Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the commercial lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the lright thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 or 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

measure.title: Opsonophagocytic Titers of Vaccine Pneumococcal Serotypes
measure.description: Titers are presented as Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs). Pneumococcal serotypes included 1, 4, 5, 6B, 7F, 9V, 14, 18C, 19F and 23F.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom immunogenicity data were available.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Solicited Local and General Symptoms.
outcome.description: Solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, fever, irritability, loss of appetite, diarrhoea and vomiting.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which inlcuded all vaccinated subjects.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group

outcome.title: Occurrence of Unsolicited Adverse Events
outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects.

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

measure.title: Occurrence of Unsolicited Adverse Events
measure.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject, temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product.
measure.population: Analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated Cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects.

reported_events.time_frame: Frequent AEs were assessed during the 4-day (day 0-3) follow-up period after vaccination for solicited AEs and 31-day (day 0-30) follow-up period for unsolicited AEs. SAEs were assessed from month 0 until study end (month 4).

group.title: Synflorix Clinical Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the clinical lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the right thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 and 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months of age in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

group.title: Synflorix Commercial Lot & Infanrix Group
group.description: Subjects received 3 doses of the commercial lot of Synflorix TM (GSK1024850A) intramuscularly in the lright thigh at 2-3-5 months of age (= study month 0, 1, 3) co-administered with a DTPa-combined vaccine (Infanrix hexa TM (at 2, 3 or 5 months of age in Malaysia or 2 and 5 months in Singapore) or Infanrix-IPV/Hib TM (at 3 months of age in Singapore)) intramuscularly in the left thigh and Rotarix TM orally at 2-3 months of age (= study month 0, 1).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
